item.title: ICE just tried to deport this woman, but there was just one problem — she was Native American.
item.description:
You read that right: Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) — the agency supposedly tasked with deporting undocumented immigrants — just tried to deport an Indigenous woman whose ancestors have been here for thousands of years. Leticia Jacobo, a 24-year-old member of Arizona’s Salt River Pima-Maricopa Indian Community, was born in Phoenix — but that didn’t stop ICE from trying to ship her “back” to a country she doesn’t even belong to.
Let that sink in: the United States government almost deported an Indigenous woman from her own country. It’s time to abolish this corrupt and incompetent agency that can’t even tell the difference between an immigrant and an Indigenous citizen.

item.title: trolling is ai art
item.description: I actually use some AI art in places where it doesn't matter. Like I have Telegram groups for friends and family, and I get AI to make me cute little badges with glowy text. That's a perfect use of AI. They're not all quite consistent, but close enough, and it looks nice. Do I use AI on my websites? Not for my clients, hell no. On most of my personal sites, nah. I did use a Ghibli-style filter on some of my photography for one site, and I like it, but I can understand if others hate it. I'm just saying - I think there's a place for it, but that place is relatively rare. And certainly not in any professional use - except to generate placeholders with the clear understanding that they MUST be replaced and are JUST placeholders. EDIT: Some people apparently have reading comprehension problems and don't understand: "Thing is generally bad, but here are a few exceptions I think are alright" and go all "YOU SUPPORT THE THING! YOU SUCK THING'S DICK!!!! OMG YOU ARE TEH EVIL AND SUPPORT THE THING!!!!!1!!1!!1111oneone11eleventy!!1111" and to THOSE people I say please learn how language fucking works.

26 Imgur Creator Spotlight: My friend @rbeeseart paints birds. Chickadees are so cute. Go check out her stuff, it's wonderful.
27 Man Tax: Jason Statham
“I'm not aware of too many things. I know what I know if you know what I mean.” Edie Brickell I try to keep my posts "good vibe zones". So, instead of finding the one thing in here you don't like and commenting only on that, also comment about something you DID like. Balance the negativity. Love you long time. So, I made a discord server. It's a relaxed environment where you can take/donate memes to the cause, play trivia twice a week, chat about lots of topics or about nothing at all. We also have Jack Box game night and are setting up movie night! Very laid back/relaxed vibe. Come hang with us. https://discord.gg/AWFV7FT3RQ I'm also on the imgcat server for updates & fun: https://discord.gg/TpjD37jgJ9 ***Also if you miss abbiistabbii's discord community good news! You can now find it here https://discord.gg/6nrrXJQa - where everyone's reconnecting, shitposting, and hanging out again*** https://ko-fi.com/mememuseumcurator Unable to work and pretty destitute. Feel free to leave me a tip. Those that have, y'all are the bee's knees. You've helped me so much. ***Tag me if you see an artist/creator you like whose work isn't getting seen as much as it should be! Or if you are an artist/creator and want me to post something of yours, DM me!

item.title: Let's learn about passports!
item.description:
I'm bored while "working" from home, so let's learn fun stuff about modern passports. My inspiration (besides boredom) comes from having previously worked at an airport to help passengers with reduced mobility. In my 18 months doing this, I handled all kinds of travel documents. To help with our lesson, let's use Passport Index [https://www.passportindex.org/]. They have some handy tools to determine the best passports in terms of how much freedom it gives the carrier in crossing international borders. Let's get started with an example.
Why Mongolia? I mean: just *look* at the design. It's badass! Mongolia has a passport that ranks as the 62nd most mobile globally, a rank it shares with Kenya & Tunisia.
Where does that rank come from? The basic formula is the number of countries that allow visa-free travel for Mongolian passport-holders plus the number of countries that allow for visa-on-arrival / visa online / etc. plus countries that use Electronic Travel Authorization (ETA). Visa-free + visa-on-arrival + ETA = Global Mobility Score
Putting in Mongolia's numbers: 34 (visa-free) + 40 (visa-on-arrival) + 4 (ETA) = 78. That leaves another 120 countries that require visas for Mongolian passport-holders. This will most likely involve filling out applications & paying fees at an embassy or a consulate. Now for some fun bits of trivia! Which country has the lowest global mobility score?
Poor Afghanistan... With a score of 38, only 3 countries globally allow Afghan passport-holders to travel visa-free.
Just about anywhere Afghans go, they will more likely than not need a visa.
Moving on to another topic: the continent with countries that have the lowest global mobility scores is Africa. Which African country do you think has the best score?
South Africa has visa-free access 58 countries, visa-on-arrival with another 47, & ETA with an additional 5. This gives it a score of 110 & a rank of 45th worldwide. Let's compare the best passport in Africa to the weakest passport among European Union members, a distinction which belongs to Cyprus.
Tied for 7th globally with Iceland, Cypriots can go to 121 other countries visa-free, another 7 with ETA, & 42 more with visa-on-arrival. Even the weakest passport in the European Union has much greater mobility than the strongest passport in Africa. It's like racism still exists or something. Fun bonus fact: Cyprus passport-holders seem to still need a visa for the United States. Most EU countries have a visa-waiver program with the States (basically ETA), but Cyprus remains an exception. Moving on to some passport oddities... Which Chinese passport do you think has the best score? No, I don't mean the People's Republic of China or the Republic of China. You may not know that mainland China actually has 3 distinct passports: one for the People's Republic of China, one for Macau, & one for Hong Kong. The best of these passports goes to Hong Kong, with a global rank of 12th.
Staying in Asia, let's find out which country has the best global mobility score. Before we reveal it, here are some hints. 1) Only about 11% of the population of this country are citizens there. The others are guest workers & foreign residents who will almost certainly never naturalize. 2) They're rich (cuz of course!). 3) You have probably seen the place in action movies or on TV. 4) The government there is officially a constitutional monarchy, but don't let that fool you: the human rights record they have is atrocious.
Only 19 countries require UAE passport-holders to have a visa. Emiratis travel visa-free to 125 countries & another 8 with ETA.
It's interesting to see the combination of countries that require a visa for UAE citizens: Liberia, North Korea, Turkmenistan, Cameroon, Myanmar, & the United States (among others). Strange to see these on the same list, isn't it? Next, a fun observation about Haiti: they are overwhelmingly visa-free with visitors to their country. One of the few places that requires a visa just happens to be the only country with which they share a land border: the Dominican Republic.
Why Haiti? Why would y'all make your closest neighbors get a visa? The two countries actually have a long history of fighting each other. Sad... Next snippet: this one surprised me quite a bit. Which Muslim-majority country in Southeast Asia has a passport that gives its people mobility comparable to that of many European Union (or European Economic Area) states?
Malaysia! With a rank of 3rd worldwide (shared with Belgium, France, Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Finland, Luxembourg, Italy, Denmark, Portugal, Switzerland, Greece, Austria, Norway, & the Republic of Ireland), Malaysians have a passport that gives greater mobility than the United Kingdom, Canada, or the United States.
Although, funny enough Malaysians still need ETA for the U.K. & a visa for both Canada & the U.S. Let's wrap up with some tremendously rare passports. First, y'all know that part of western Africa that's almost always greyed out in maps? Called Western Sahara, the area is claimed & mostly administered by Morocco.
But there is a sliver of land controlled by the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic. Their passports (recognized by no one as best as I can tell) look like this:
A penultimate peculiarity: would you believe that there is a partially recognized passport issued by a sovereign entity that doesn't control any physical land? Well, that happens to exist. The official name for this Catholic organization is (deep breath) the Sovereign Military Hospitaller Order of Saint John of Jerusalem, of Rhodes & of Malta.
Remember that these are not passports for the Republic of Malta. Malta is part of both the EU & Schengen, while the Sovereign Military Order of Malta is not. Got it? The Order of Malta passport has some international recognition, meaning holders can travel internationally using this document alone (depending on where they go). Strange, isn't it? A final thought about passports: they seem boring. Most of the world only deals with renewing them every decade or so. But this is what we rely on when we travel abroad.
Look at all those planes that were in the air on the morning of November 14th, 2025. The ones crossing the Atlantic Ocean or leaving one continent for another are almost certainly going to land somewhere that when the passengers disembark (and assuming they do not have a connecting flight in the transit area), they will have to proceed through passport control. To get through, they need this little booklet that proves who they are. That they have a name. That they were born somewhere on a certain day. That they have jumped through the proper hoops to secure a visa or other necessary documentation. It's weird that a person itself is not proof enough. [Sources: https://www.passportindex.org/ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sahrawi_passport https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sovereign_Military_Order_of_Malta_passport https://www.flightradar24.com ] Edit: thank you kindly for FP & the accolades.

item.title: Weight + Gravity = A Disappearing Headstone
item.description:
*have damages - that was a typo. This is a repost because my dumb ass forgot to censor the usernames. Also, I decided to tag history on this post because I usually tag it in my cemetery posts. While this is mainly a scientific explanation into an event that happens in a cemetery, headstones themselves are historical artifacts. . As a few of you know, I was a volunteer headstone restorationist for my local cemetery. A lot of my work was centered about ground headstones because they get so dangerously sunken in that they become a serious tripping hazard. A lot of elderly visit cemeteries, and it only takes one bad fall to break a bone, or go down and be unable to get back up. So why do headstones sink into obscurity? Good ol’ gravity!
As gravity continues to press the headstone into the ground, the ground eventually gives way due to the weight. This causes the headstone to sink deeper into the ground over time, until it practically disappears. This is often due to neglect, but not always. Sometimes a headstone is so banged up - chipped, cracked, badly stained, etc… that exposure to the elements will simply destroy it. In these cases, the original headstone is left to sink into the ground to protect it. A new grave marker is placed in front of it with the information of the deceased.
This is a headstone that I worked on where it simply disappeared. I wouldn’t have even noticed it if I hadn’t thought to myself: “Why is this patch of moss an almost perfect rectangle?”
This is an example of a headstone that you let Mother Nature take over. It’s made of slate, and basically a stub with a barely legible name. There’s not enough pieces to put it back together. Image source: https://blog.billiongraves.com/damaged-gravestones/
This one is iffier. With my knowledge on headstones, I would let this one go. It’s broken in three places, overrun by at least ONE colony of lichen, but it looks like two from here. @Springchikun would probably able to fix this one (she’s way more skilled than I am), but I also wouldn’t blame her if she said that this one is a goner. Image source: https://www.freep.com/picture-gallery/news/2016/10/01/photos-day-of-mercy-cleanup-at-quaker-cemetery-in-farmington/91397912/
Sadly, my time volunteering in the cemetery is over. We have a new mayor in our town, which means that had to get my permissions renewed before I could keep working in there. I do not want to deal with our new mayor. He’s a really awful person. His secretary ran for mayor. He originally promised to sponsor her, and then stabbed her in the back by running for mayor instead, despite the fact that he’s a school teacher. When he won the election, he cut his secretary’s hours in half as punishment for running against him. I do not want to have to answer to this guy. I don’t trust him to not give me permission, and then decide to have me arrested for defacing public property right after that. I’ve decided to just let my permissions “expire” and not renew them. I’m sure that might seem cowardly to some of you, but I feel like it would be reckless to place my trust in an untrustworthy and malicious individual. Still, I hope you enjoyed this post!

item.title: Poison Ivy - MCroft07
item.description: I AM IN THE UK AND HAVE BEEN BLOCKED FROM USING IMGUR!!! I managed to get on here with a VPN but Imgur doesn't like Vpns so I might lose access again soon. Basically, every time I post is a day I can get on here. Thank you so much to those people who want to try and help me with private VPNs but I have really bad tech aura and I break a lot of things so this is truly the best way forward, also I'm scared of being told off for spamming on here haha. IF you still want to follow me and see what I am doing please PLEASE find me on https://linktr.ee/mcroft07?utm_source=linktree_profile_share I HATE THE GOVERNMENTS TOO I've painted poison ivy so many times, I just haven't painted her much recently so thought I would do it again! I tried to incorporate her signature pose in the end and I love how it turned out! Faq: I use body paint and do these in a mirror No, it is not AI I just looked at an anatomical drawing of a skeleton and copied it I use professional body paint covers (pasties) this means I am not wearing a top but I am also not naked. I paint myself, I make the props myself, I film myself, and I also edit. This is my full time thing now (yayy) I paint these by looking in a mirror, with brushes, and paint It takes between 6-12 hours each Body painting myself is my hobby/passion I do own clothes It doesn’t tickle “Why don’t you just wear clothes” once again, body painting myself is my hobby/passion. I am painting my skin, I am not wearing a suit - but that does not mean I am naked. I know, even I think this is a ridiculous set of questions I have to constantly answer I did not go to art school, I am self taught. Talent gets you so far, but this is a learned skill. The paint isn’t edible (gross) I've been painting myself for 16 years. The 07 does not mean I was born in 2007, UK 7 is my shoe size No, I don't need help painting my back, I don't want to paint my back, I don't need to paint my back. (also gross) No, I don't need help washing it off. (also you are gross) If you want to see more I am MCroft07 on IG, twitter, Tiktok, YouTube I paint them live on twitch I like doing the lip syncs, they're fun for me while I paint them. I couldn’t care less if you think they’re cringe. I am cringe but I am free My tattoos on my ribs are from Tomb Raider - I am a big TR fan I do not have an OF but if you want to send me money THAT badly you can just tip my twitch account. Haha. The shower afterwards takes about 15 minutes, I use a regular sponge and shower gel. The reason why it can look different at the end is because I am wearing a wig, I promise you it is not a different person because the hair changed. While on this topic, if my eyes change colour it’s because I am wearing contact lenses. (Those with an IQ above 10… I know. Even I’m shocked the wig thing is a frequent comment). I use body paint. It doesn’t tickle, I am very ticklish and this is fine. I don’t have an allergic reaction to the paint, but if you do it, you should always do a patch test first I do not know where you can buy body paint in every country. I know in the UK it is available at FacePaintingshop.com. I use a plethora of different brands, it’s best to search for them yourself online. I don’t work in Hollywood, I don’t want to. I just want to improve my body painting for myself. I am English, not American. I do not go outside like this to scare people. 1, that would be very cold. 2, in this current age, everyone would take photos without me knowing and it would likely dox me :)))))) I’m not a sweaty person, but if I was this would be a lot more difficult. Thank you to those of you who came from Imgur to my Twitch channel! “What’s the point in painting yourself when you can wear clothes?” all my clothes are in the laundry, had to resort to this, tough life It would not be quicker to jump into a pool of paint - think of the drying time?! If I did a Spyro makeup look on wednesday and it has gotten me in the mood to play Spyro again but I have heard so much about Dispatch so I think I'm going to play that on twitch tonight :) I'm super excited! I hope I find new characters to paint in it but my friend told me that there is a man's ding dong in the first ten minutes I don’t care that I wash it off at the end, I get to reuse this canvas, we love a reduce, reuse, recycle queen. I am not the lady who did the Maneskin video, it’s a cool video and she slayed, but it isn’t me. I can promise you there is not *a man* painting these and I am pretending to paint myself. I am genuinely painting myself. I know a lot of you don’t like reading this faq because it is horrid to see that I have to answer all of these. Unfortunately I have noticed that when I don’t put in all the icky things then I get more gross comments and I just have to spend more time blocking people so it’s better to call it out. I just copy and paste it each time anyway.
item.dc:creator: MCroft07

item.title: Return of the Meme: 1525 (Weatherwaxing)
item.description:
Let's get this bread or something
My body again betrays me this morning: woke up an hour earlier than normal because of the demand for bodily functions, plus having removed my new mouthpiece multiple times in the night along with my mask... I womder if I can get tie-down straps for my arms, since I dont have anyone to tie me up.
Oh, and the aforementioned stress vomiting.
Yesterday I got off Scott free, so to speak: the boss that's not on vacation texted me as I was about to leave saying she was taking a sick day and since there wasn't anyone to train me, I may as well take off too.
I offered to go in and do what I knew how to do, but was rebuffed, so... unexpected weekday off.
@evilcoffeechick and I seek to ask the ancestors for advice, they say dig a hole and eat tubers.
I immediately went to the local AZ economic aid office to get back on the state Healthcare plan, because either I stay hired but have two months without insurance as my brain possibly gets worse, or I get fired at the end of the week because my letter isn't good enough or to their specifications or I fall asleep again today despite my attempts.... but I have insurance.
I needed two pieces of paperwork. Went to the jeep tour place and saw the old HR person is gone, replace with someone who was a receptionist when I started. I'm proud of her a d how far she's come in 5 years. It was a nice mini-visit and that paperwork was done no problem. Still waiting for the second piece from the winery consulting gig, he was supposed to send it last night at 6, but, uh. Didn't.
Ended up doing a little birding after that on my way home and saw Buffleheads and a Sora rail at the marsh and ponds outside of Sedona which was awesome. Then went to visit Kayla's flock while she was on vacation because I haven't had the time or energy to visit. They all seemed happy to visit.
Anyway here i am this morning with an upset stomach and stress bleeding and petting Pippin and again unsure what the future will hold.
These are all good books.
Hahaha
Pretty sure Pippin would be a barbarian or a rogue.
It's called Enrichment.
Oh this made me sad. We're gonna see another Gilgamesh tablet drop before we see Doors of Stone: if ever.
Jaskier is That Guy
Replace "our cat" with "Pippin" and this indeed could be you!
Hahahahahhahaha
Also me, every fucking night, *which is why I plan for it, going to bed at 8 fucking PM except on game night*
Sinosauropteryx fabric art.
If only this had happened.
Hahahaha. Reference to a classic joke about what makes a dialect different from a language.
I would like to hear, audibly, praise once in a while. Reading it doesn't work.
Let me tell you about Orthodoxy...
Mood.
I remember this from when I lived in Jerome. I once had 15 hummingbirds at my feeders at once.
Pippin tax! Today's message from Pippin: [angry nibbles on fingers because I stopped petting him to ask him what his message was]
